meanings.definition: A domestic fowl, especially a hen.
meanings.sent1: The chook laid an egg in the coop.
meanings.sent2: I fed the chook some grains in the morning.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chook cross the road? To get to the other side!
meanings.sent4: The chook's feathers were as colorful as a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The chook's clucking woke me up at dawn.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or run away.
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to chook when it saw the dog approaching.
meanings.sent2: I had to chook to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: I chooked out of the room when I heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel chooked up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit chooked into its burrow to hide from the fox.
